basics.name: Mohamed Hemdan
basics.label: Ph.D. Student
basics.summary: Ph.D. student in Computer Science at the University of Minnesota, specializing in spatial data management and federated learning. Experienced in machine learning, big data processing, and computer vision.

work.name: Microsoft, Cairo, Egypt
work.summary: Analyzed user interactions and features to determine high-importance factors in user engagement with news and notifications.
highlights: Collaborated with the WebXT notifications team.
Identified key features for improved user experience and engagement.

work.name: European Council for Nuclear Research (CERN), Geneva, Switzerland
work.summary: Developed and distributed GAN model training for calorimeter simulations across CERN servers and the LHC computing grid. Adapted models to federated learning for large-scale data access.
highlights: Worked on federated learning for high-energy physics simulations.
Developed distributed GAN models for large-scale data.

work.name: envelope.network, Boston, MA, US (Remote)
work.summary: Developed a browser extension to extract interest from browsing history and match it with ads.
highlights: Developed a Chrome extension to analyze user browsing history.

work.name: Alexandria University, Alexandria, Egypt
work.summary: Introduced a data augmentation technique for outdoor localization systems using conditional GANs, improving accuracy by 22.2%.
highlights: Improved data augmentation techniques for WiFi localization.

awards.title: KAUST Ph.D. Fellowship (declined)
awards.summary: Received the prestigious KAUST Ph.D. fellowship but declined to pursue studies at the University of Minnesota.

awards.title: Excellence in Undergraduate Research Award
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding undergraduate research in computer engineering.

awards.title: Dr. Sherif El-Kassas Award
awards.summary: Awarded for academic excellence in computer science.

awards.title: Dr. Abdel Rahman El Sawy Endowed Award
awards.summary: Awarded for distinguished achievement in engineering.

awards.title: Dean’s List
awards.summary: Achieved Dean’s List status for outstanding academic achievement for multiple years.

awards.title: Outstanding Scholarship Student Award
awards.summary: Awarded for excellent academic performance in 2017-2018.

certificates.name: Micro Masters in Statistics and Data Science

publications.name: Federated Learning Strategies of Generative Adversarial Networks for High Energy Physics Calorimeter Simulation
publications.summary: Paper focused on federated learning strategies using GANs for calorimeter simulations in high-energy physics.

publications.name: Indoor Localization System for Seamless Tracking Across Buildings and Network Configurations
publications.summary: Developed a seamless indoor localization system adaptable to changing network configurations.

publications.name: Data Augmentation using GANs for Deep Learning-based Localization Systems
publications.summary: Proposed a GAN-based data augmentation technique to improve the accuracy of deep learning-based localization systems.

projects.name: Federated Learning for Calorimeter Simulation
projects.summary: Developed a distributed GAN training model for calorimeter simulations at CERN. Adapted models for federated learning to access large-scale data across the LHC computing grid.
highlights: Improved GAN training efficiency across distributed systems.
